questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15395

Which of the following can be said according to the given situation?

Your friend wants to study abroad, but she isn't sure if she can afford it. Her family income doesn't seem to be enough to support her, either. She asks for your opinion; you want to encourage her and also want to relieve her financially. You say:

 

A) Why don't you consider some local universities?
B) Don't bother your family, you know their financial condition.
C) I think studying somewhere around here is better for your family.
D) I'm sure you'll manage it, you can work part-time for your expenses as well.
E) Try to understand your parents. They will miss you if you go abroad.
A B C D E
questionText: Which of the following can be said according to the given situation? Your friend wants to study abroad, but she isn't sure if she can afford it. Her family income doesn't seem to be enough to support her, either. She asks for your opinion; you want to encourage her and also want to relieve her financially. You say: A) Why don't you consider some local universities? B) Don't bother your family, you know their financial condition. C) I think studying somewhere around here is better for your family. D) I'm sure you'll manage it, you can work part-time for your expenses as well. E) Try to understand your parents. They will miss you if you go abroad. A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15396

 Find the correct Turkish translation of the given sentence below. 

Youngsters are the biggest portion of society and have fashion-conscious since they demand to be free in clothes.

A) Gençler toplumun en büyük kesimini oluşturdukları için modayı takip ederler çünkü kıyafetlerinde özgür olmak isterler.
B) Gençler toplumun en büyük kesimini oluştururlar ve modayı takip ettikleri kadar, kıyafetlerinde de özgür olmayı talep ederler.
C) Gençler toplumun en büyük kesimini oluşturmasalar da, kıyafetlerde özgür olmayı talep ettikleri için modayı takip ederler.
D) Gençler toplumun en büyük kesimini oluştururlar ve kıyafetlerde özgür olmayı talep ettikleri için moda bilincine sahiptirler.
E) Modayı, özgür olmak ve istedikleri kıyafetleri seçmek için takip eden gençler, toplumun en büyük kesimini oluştururlar.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15397

Which of the following is the correct order of the dialogue ?

I- Well, I don't agree with you. What you wear says who you are.

II- Do you like trendy jackets, Jack?

III- Because I want to give you something special on your birthday.

IV- Not actually. I like the classical ones. Why do you ask?

V- Being stylish doesn't mean wearing up-to-date clothes and following fashion trends.

VI- There is no need for this, but thanks anyway.

VII- Why do you say so? Don't you like being stylish?

A) II - IV - III - VI - VII - V - I
B) II - IV - III - VII - VI - V - I
C) II - IV - VII - III - V - I - VI
D) II - III - IV - VI - VII - V - I
E) II - III - IV - VI - V - I - VII
A B C D E

III- Because I want to give you something special on your birthday. IV- Not actually. I like the classical ones. Why do you ask? V- Being stylish doesn't mean wearing up-to-date clothes and following fashion trends. VI- There is no need for this, but thanks anyway. VII- Why do you say so? Don't you like being stylish? A) II - IV - III - VI - VII - V - I B) II - IV - III - VII - VI - V - I C) II - IV - VII - III - V - I - VI D) II - III - IV - VI - VII - V - I E) II - III - IV - VI - V - I - VII A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15398

 Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

After eighteen years, the musical, Phantom of the Opera, has become the longest-running show in Broadway history. It is also among the most successful entertainment productions of any kind ever. Across the world, Phantom is calculated to have made three point two billion dollars. Compare that to the highest-grossing Hollywood movie, Titanic, which grossed less than half of that figure. Phantom originally opened to mixed reviews, but eighteen years later it is still playing to big audiences every night.

The best title for this passage is ...... .

A)  Big Audiences Love The Phantom of the Opera
B)  Titanic and The Phantom of the Opera
C)  The World of Musicals
D)  The Big Success of The Phantom of the Opera
E)  Entertainment Failures
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15431

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

3D technology has brought many improvements into our lives, like the 3D TV. It has incredible depth, stunning sound, clarity and color. Moreover, it is the product of glasses-free, ultra-thin and energy-efficient engineering. The entertainment business will never be the same. If you're a gamer, it will give you great satisfaction with its resolution because it has '4K' (a format four times the resolutions of current HD sets) resolution. On the other hand, there stands the 3D cell phone. With this phone, the video you've shot can be seen on the phone screen without the need for special glasses. However, because of the visual angle limit, only one person can still see it clearly in 3D, unlike a 3D TV. You will be able to capture 3D content with a special double camera on the back of the phone.

According to the passage, 3D TV possesses ...... .

A)  a technique for consuming less energy
B)  nearly the same features as a 3D cell phone does
C)  energy twice as much as a 4K TV
D)  colors worse than a 3D cell phone  
E)  engineers that have conservative energy methods
A B C D E

  Read the paragraph and answer the question.

    Hi, I’m Lindsay. I’m a 9th grade student. My mom takes me to school every morning and then, she goes to work. Yesterday I was late for school. Because when my mom and I were about to get on the car, we noticed that another car had been parked just behind ours on the street. We had to wait for the driver to arrive for about ten minutes. Then, he pulled his car into an empty parking space, and we got on ours, fastened our seat belts and guess what…? It didn’t work! Mom told me to get out of the car and push it. At first, I thought mom was kidding me, but when I looked at her in the rear view mirror, I understood that she was extremely serious. Desperately, I did what she said but nothing changed, the car didn’t work again. So, we had to call a taxi. When I finally arrived at school, it was nearly 9.30. That meant I had missed nearly the half of the first lesson.

Choose the question that does not have an answer in the paragraph.

A) Did Lindsay’s teacher get angry with her for she was late to class?
B) What grade is Lindsay in?
C) How long did Lindsay and her mom wait for the driver of the other car?
D) What did Lindsay think when her mom told her to push the car?
E) What time did Lindsay arrive at school?
A B C D E

At first, I thought mom was kidding me, but when I looked at her in the rear view mirror, I understood that she was extremely serious. Desperately, I did what she said but nothing changed, the car didn’t work again. So, we had to call a taxi. When I finally arrived at school, it was nearly 9.30. That meant I had missed nearly the half of the first lesson.

Choose the question that does not have an answer in the paragraph.
options: Did Lindsay’s teacher get angry with her for she was late to class?
How long did Lindsay and her mom wait for the driver of the other car?
What did Lindsay think when her mom told her to push the car?
What time did Lindsay arrive at school?

  Read the paragraph and answer the question.

    Hi, I’m Lindsay. I’m a 9th grade student. My mom takes me to school every morning and then, she goes to work. Yesterday I was late for school. Because when my mom and I were about to get on the car, we noticed that another car had been parked just behind ours on the street. We had to wait for the driver to arrive for about ten minutes. Then, he pulled his car into an empty parking space, and we got on ours, fastened our seat belts and guess what…? It didn’t work! Mom told me to get out of the car and push it. At first, I thought mom was kidding me, but when I looked at her in the rear view mirror, I understood that she was extremely serious. Desperately, I did what she said but nothing changed, the car didn’t work again. So, we had to call a taxi. When I finally arrived at school, it was nearly 9.30. That meant I had missed nearly the half of the first lesson.

It is clear in the passage that…

A) Lindsay goes to school by bus every morning.
B) Lindsay and her mom never fasten their seat belts when they get on the car.
C) the car didn’t work because they ran out of petrol.
D) Lindsay and her mom had to leave the car there and call a taxi.
E) Lindsay didn’t help her mom while trying to start the car. 
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52808

Choose the correct option to complete the statement according to the paragraph.

Some people try to convince themselves that they don’t need friends at all because they find it difficult to make and keep friends. But there are many good reasons for wanting to have friends. If you are going through hard times, a helping friend can turn the negative sides of life into positive with his/her support and encouragement. Also, having reliable friends around you is important as they can help you build your confidence. By means of those friends, you can even get out and start things that you haven’t considered doing on your own, such as sports, social clubs, and so on. Friends who are respectful, hardworking, tolerant, honest, fair, helpful and generous with their time, will be positive influencers in your life by developing those values of yours. Briefly, you need friends, and they need you.

The author of the passage states that…

A) family members are always more important than friends. 
B) not only you need friends but also they need you.
C) making friends is easy for everyone.
D) developing some values is not possible without friends.
E) it takes some time to make friends and keep them in your life.
A B C D E

Also, having reliable friends around you is important as they can help you build your confidence. By means of those friends, you can even get out and start things that you haven’t considered doing on your own, such as sports, social clubs, and so on. questionAsHtml:

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

There has been a controversy going on between generations since the beginning of human history. Many parents who have been actively involved in their children's early years stand aside the moment their children become teenagers. This counts on the common belief that once the children have become teenagers, there's nothing more parents can do. However, studies clearly show that it's still important for parents to be involved when the children are teenagers. Good parenting continues to help teenagers develop in healthy ways, stay out of trouble and do well in school. According to experts, parents shouldn't fluctuate when they wish to praise their teenage children or to show them physical affection. 

About the parents who have teenage children, it is clearly stated in the passage that ...... .

A)  they should show no hesitation when they want to praise their children
B)  they had better show some respect to their children's private lives
C)  they need to be more careful towards their children as youngsters are fragile 
D)  they should take part in their children's school life regardless of any objections
E)  nobody should intervene with teenagers' school lives 
A B C D E

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

Anorexia is an attempt to control your life and emotions. Your self-esteem depends on how much you weigh and how thin you are (you feel fat despite being underweight). Becoming thin is more important than being healthy. Obsession with calories, fat grams and nutrition (you always measure and weigh portions), pretending to eat or lying about eating (you always make excuses not to have meals) obsessively thinking about food (you cook for others and make meal plans although you eat very little), having very strange food rituals, (you chew and spit it out) obsession about how you look in the mirror and what you can and cannot do, are significant features of an anorexic.

One can infer from the passage that, an anorexic person's self-esteem relies on ...... .

A) the way one tries to lose weight especially on a diet 
B) one's motivations for being thin rather than being healthy
C) the frequency that one eats his / her meals in spite of having a balanced diet
D) how slim one looks and how many kilos one weighs
E) measuring literally each portion one has
A B C D E

E) I-a, II-a, III-b, IV-a

Choose the correct option according to the answers of the questions in each dialogue.

 

I. Jane: What do you think about jobs in the future?

a. James: I think, people will have the professions that do not exist today.

b. James: I think, people are going to have the professions that do not exist today.

II. Sue: Hey, Helen! Shall we go out tonight?

a. Helen: I’m sorry but I can’t. I will meet with Susan for our final project.

b. Helen: I’m sorry but I can’t. I am going to meet with Susan for our final project.

III. Peter: What will life be like when you are 60?

a. Sam: I guess people will have self-driven cars.

b. Sam: I guess people are going to have self-driven cars.

IV. Joseph: Do you have any holiday plans?

a. Kevin: Yes, of course. I will go to Svalbard, Norway to see the northern lights.

b. Kevin: Yes, of course. I am going to go to Svalbard, Norway to see the northern lights.

A) I-a, II-b, III-b, IV-b
B) I-b, II-a, III-a, IV-b
C) I-a, II-b, III-a, IV-b
D) I-a, II-a, III-a, IV-b
E) I-b, II-b, III-a, IV-b
A B C D E

1

2

3

Jane: Will you come to Sally’s birthday party?

4

Jane: Will John be late?

5

Jane: Will you buy this red car?

Julia: I can’t make up my mind.

B) 2
C) 3
D) 4
E) 5
A B C D E

Alex: ......

Bety: Well, you can keep a diary to see if you have a seasonal pattern. For example, if you feel worse and more stressed from December to February and you clear up later, you may have winter blues.

Alex: Is it just about winter?

Bety: Of course not. As it is scientifically proven; fall, spring or summer can also cause a seasonal disorder. Researches show that seasons affect our basic functions such as sleeping, eating and the way we behave.

A) I feel restlessness and excitement these days.
B) These grey days seem to be lasting forever, don't they?
C) Once I see the blue sky, I can't concentrate on my work.
D) What can I do to spend more time in nature in the rest of my life?
E) How can we understand that we are seasonally affected?
A B C D E

C) That's what you are going to tell about, isn't it? D) Note that the weather does not affect all the people in the same way or intensity. E) Scientists say that both winter and summer have the same effects upon adults. A B C D E
question:
Choose the correct option to complete the paragraph.
Seasons can cause changes not only in mood, but also in the energy level, sleeping, eating, and social behaviour of people. ...... For instance, snowflakes bring sadness to most as well as happiness to some.
options: But how can we understand that we are seasonally affected?
Although I eat a lot in winter, I feel hungry all day.
That's what you are going to tell about, isn't it?
Note that the weather does not affect all the people in the same way or intensity.
Scientists say that both winter and summer have the same effects upon adults.

I. In fact, you are not hungry. It's all about your mood. How do you feel in general? Tired and sleepy?

D) III - V - IV - II - I
E) II - IV - III - I - V
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

Although many young people use computers in a creative way, surveys suggest that they may experience psychological problems such as loneliness, isolation and depression. The main reason for these problems is the time allocated to computers. Psychologists advise parents to limit the time spent on the Net and to devote more time to physical activities and imaginative plays. They also say that family gatherings and short holidays without computers may be a good way to socialize their children. There are also advice centres whose aim is to inform parents about using the computer in a balanced way.

According to the passage in order to make their children more sociable, parents ...... .

A) shouldn't let their children spend time
B) should lead their life without computer
C) should organise family activities to spend more time with their children
D) should go online, too
E) should tell their children to use computers creatively
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15550

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

Patch Adams is best known for his work as a medical doctor and a clown, but he is also a social activist who has devoted over 40 years of his life to changing America's healthcare system. He believes that laughter, joy and creativity are an integral part of the healing process and, with the help of friends, he founded the Gesundheit Institute in 1971 in order to address all the problems of health care in one model. The Gesundheit Institute, a non-profit healthcare organization, is a project in holistic medical care based on the belief that one cannot separate the health of the individual from the health of the family, the community, the society, and the world. Their mission is to reframe and reclaim the concept of 'hospital'.

According to Adams, ...... .

A) laughter, joy and creativity are indivisible parts for the recovery period
B) Gesundheit Institute deals with only some problems of health care
C) today's hospitals are insufficient to heal the patients
D) it is not necessary to change America's healthcare system
E) the Institute should be a profit-oriented healthcare system
A B C D E

Answer the question according to the paragraph below.

Every problem has its own subject and is different from any other. Each problem has its own way of making us feel one way or another. How do you feel when a problem appears suddenly? Do you feel depressed and pessimistic or calm and optimistic? In fact, it is a normal part of life. Everyone has problems. You're not a superhero. Be realistic! Don't take it too seriously. Just be aware that it won't last forever. Share your feelings and don't hesitate to ask for help whenever you feel desperate.

What is the best title for the paragraph?

A) Coping with problems
B) Anxiety and stress
C) Teenagers' so called depression
D) Living out of reality
E) Tips for meditation
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52953

Answer the question according to the paragraph below.

Your mood will change if you use your body in a different way. For example, if you want to feel better, try to smile for some time.  If you want to feel confident, stand up and walk slowly and lift your head up and your back straight. You’ll feel more confident. If you feel down, just look up! You will see the sky, and it will put you in a good mood. It is even better to combine everything at once.

What is the best title for the paragraph?

A) Work out to feel happier!
B) Change your physiology to feel better!
C) Be more confident for success!
D) Feel happier than you were yesterday!
E) Change your psychology to feel happier!
A B C D E

Jenny: Hi Sam! How are you doing nowadays?

Sam: Hi Jenny! I’m working hard. You know I’ve had some troubles with my studies and I need to cover everything till the end of the month. But I can’t cope with the workload, so I feel a little bit anxious.

Jenny: No worries! You will do your best.

Sam: I will but there is a very little time left.

Jenny: All will be fine. …

A) Take a deep breath and think positive!
B) Call the bank and ask for the account!
C) Tell me what you think about it!
D) Love all the people around you!
E) Do not wait for me till the morning!

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 15607

Answer the following question according to the paragraph.

The history of paper began nearly five thousand years ago in Ancient Egypt, where papyrus was used to write on. Firstly, the Sumerians had used clay tablets, which were not light and solid. Ts'ai Lun is credited for creating the first sheet of paper by mixing plant fibres with old rags and leaving the mixture to dry. Before the invention of paper, documents in China had been written on bone tablets or bamboo scrolls. Silk was used too, yet it was expensive. Paper spread slowly out of China to the Middle East; however, it didn't reach Europe until a thousand years later. People were still using animal skins to make a thin material called parchment. Wood replaced plant fibres in papermaking to make the process cheaper.

Which of the following is the best title for the paragraph?

A) Sumerians and the Paper
B) Paper Making Industry in China
C) Clay Tablets and Animal Skins
D) History of Wood and Fibres
E) Papermaking Over the Centuries
A B C D E

Paper spread slowly out of China to the Middle East; however, it didn't reach Europe until a thousand years later. People were still using animal skins to make a thin material called parchment. Choose the correct option to complete the sentence according to the paragraph.
The history of paper began nearly five thousand years ago in Ancient Egypt, where papyrus was used to write on. Firstly, the Sumerians had used clay tablets, which were not light and solid. Ts'ai Lun is credited for creating the first sheet of paper by mixing plant fibres with old rags and leaving the mixture to dry. Before the invention of paper, documents in China had been written on bone tablets or bamboo scrolls. Silk was used too, yet it was expensive. Paper spread slowly out of China to the Middle East; however, it didn't reach Europe until a thousand years later. People were still using animal skins to make a thin material called parchment. Wood replaced plant fibres in papermaking to make the process cheaper.
In ancient times, documents in China ...... .
options: could be written only on silk
didn't reach Europe until a thousand years later
had been made by mixing plant fibres with old rags before
were written on silk, bamboo or bone tablets
were very expensive and hard to make

B) I – II – IV - V – III 
C) IV – I – III – II – V
D) III – IV – II – V – I 
E) V – I – III – IV – II
A B C D E

E) Turkish people loved him very much.

B) The writer walked to work.
C) There was a meeting about the company’s new projects.
D) The writer went to a cafe with his friends after work.
E) The writer had dinner with his friends at home.

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52994

Hezarfen Ahmed Çelebi was a curious scientist who lived between the years 1609-1640. He wanted to fly over Bosphorus. For this aim, he developed artificial wings. In 1632, he became the first man who could fly with his artificial wings from the Galata Tower to Üsküdar when he was 23 years old. Sultan Murad IV appreciated him and gave him a sack of gold as a prize for his success, but later something went wrong and Sultan Murad IV exiled Hezarfen to Algeria. Hezarfen died in Algeria in 1640.

A) Hezarfen was not successful while trying to fly over the Bosphorus.
B) Hezarfen brought the artificial wings from Algeria to fly.
C) Sultan Murad IV appreciated Hezarfen after his success and gave him a prize.
D) Hezarfen was sent to Algeria as the governor by Sultan Murad IV.
E) Hezarfen died in Üsküdar in 1640.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

Which of the following is closest in meaning to the sentence given below?

Mexico has an obesity problem because of their chilli foods; therefore, people are going on a diet nowadays in Mexico.

A) Why there is an obesity problem in Mexico is largely due to the chilli foods of Mexicans although they go on a diet recently.
B) People in Mexico are now going on a diet as a result of their chilli foods, which cause the obesity problem in Mexico.
C) People in Mexico go on a diet, but there is no relationship between the obesity problem and their eating habits of chilli foods.
D) People in Mexico are going on a diet nowadays after they face the problem of obesity, which is indirectly related with their eating chilli foods too much.
E) Nowadays, people in Mexico are eating too many chilli foods, which results in obesity, and they are likely to go on a diet.
A B C D E

Nowadays, everyone is discussing the effects of social media on our society. questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 52995

Alternative energy is defined as “energy fuelled in ways that do not use up the Earth's natural resources, otherwise harm the environment, especially by avoiding use of fossil fuels or nuclear power”. Environmental problems, some of which are global warming, climate change, pollution, deforestation or overpopulation, are mostly caused by carbon emission. Carbon is everywhere; in the air we breathe, in the food we eat and in the products we use. Household waste is also a major issue we should deal with. Putting things in garbage bags seperately or avoiding using plastic shopping bags may be of help. Another factor that should be minimized is deforestation since it may trigger floods or soil erosion. People believe that alternative energy forms are the most effective solutions to those problems as long as we can raise awareness.

Choose the option that is not true according to the paragraph.

A) Climate change and pollution are environmental problems.
B) Carbon emission is the reason behind most of the environmental problems.
C) Alternative energy is a solution to environmental problems.
D) Sorting out the garbage is essential for household waste collection.
E) There is no need to raise awareness about alternative energy sources.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 53002

Which of the following is the correct order of the sentences to make a meaningful complaint letter?

(I) I look forward to hearing from you.

(II) I trust that the chimneys will be filtered urgently or the thermal power plant will be moved to somewhere out of the city completely.

(III) Dear Sir or Madam, 

(IV) Yours faithfully,

            Mike Andrew ROSS

(V) I’m a resident of Yatağan, in Muğla. I’m writing to address a serious environmental problem in our neighbourhood.

(VI) I have been living here for five years and I have allergic asthma due to the thermal power plant that has been operating here since 1982. The air is so polluted that sometimes we can’t even breathe. Most of the residents are farmers and also busy with stockfarming. They have suffered from not only air pollution but also their agricultural products. 

(VII) I’m sure that you will do your best to solve this problem as this is a serious threat to all people and the environment.

A) V- II- VII- I- III- VI- IV 
B)  I- II- III- IV- V- VI- VII
C) III- VI- I- V- IV- II- VII
D) III- V- VI- II- VII- I- IV
E) VII- VI- V- IV- III- II- I
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 53006

Answer the following question according to the letter below.

Dear Sir or Madam, 

I’m a resident of Yatağan, in Muğla. I’m writing to address a serious environmental problem in our neighbourhood. I have been living here for five years and I have allergic asthma due to the thermal power plant that has been operating here since 1982. The air is so polluted that sometimes we can’t even breathe. Most of the residents are farmers and also busy with stock farming. Not only have they suffered from air pollution but also their agricultural products.  I trust that the chimneys will be filtered urgently or the thermal power plant will be moved to somewhere out of the city completely. I’m sure that you will do your best to solve this problem as this is a serious threat to all people and the environment.

I look forward to hearing from you.

Yours faithfully,

            Mike Andrew ROSS

What is the complaint letter about?

 

 

A) noise pollution 
B) household waste
C) air pollution
D) traffic jam
E) deforestation
A B C D E
questionText: Answer the following question according to the letter below. Dear Sir or Madam, I’m a resident of Yatağan, in Muğla. I’m writing to address a serious environmental problem in our neighbourhood. I have been living here for five years and I have allergic asthma due to the thermal power plant that has been operating here since 1982. The air is so polluted that sometimes we can’t even breathe. Most of the residents are farmers and also busy with stock farming. Not only have they suffered from air pollution but also their agricultural products.  I trust that the chimneys will be filtered urgently or the thermal power plant will be moved to somewhere out of the city completely. I’m sure that you will do your best to solve this problem as this is a serious threat to all people and the environment. I look forward to hearing from you. Yours faithfully, Mike Andrew ROSS What is the complaint letter about? A) noise pollution B) household waste C) air pollution D) traffic jam E) deforestation A B C D E
question:
Answer the following question according to the letter below. 
Dear Sir or Madam, 
I’m a resident of Yatağan, in Muğla. I’m writing to address a serious environmental problem in our neighbourhood. I have been living here for five years and I have allergic asthma due to the thermal power plant that has been operating here since 1982. The air is so polluted that sometimes we can’t even breathe. Most of the residents are farmers and also busy with stock farming. Not only have they suffered from air pollution but also their agricultural products.  I trust that the chimneys will be filtered urgently or the thermal power plant will be moved to somewhere out of the city completely. I’m sure that you will do your best to solve this problem as this is a serious threat to all people and the environment.
I look forward to hearing from you.
Yours faithfully,
          Mike Andrew ROSS
What is the complaint letter about?

A) You couldn’t sleep well last night and you are so sleepy now. Your teacher is making a presentation and you are yawning.

C) You and your husband went to the hospital to visit one of your neighbours who had had a surgery lately. You are looking for the room and speaking to your husband in a low voice.
D) Your grandfather visits you and you are just back from school. You feel tired and you want to have a rest and listen to music. You go directly to your room and don’t say hi to him.
E) One of your colleagues offered you to have lunch together. You ordered a pizza. You don’t like eating it with a knife and fork. So, you ate it with your bare hands.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:

Choose the correct option to complete the paragraph.

I hope you will accept my sincere apology for the excessive noise my class made yesterday morning. …………. I'm so sorry that we disturbed and distracted your class. I will make a greater effort in the future to keep my class's enthusiasm within acceptable limits.

A) As soon as I realized what I had done, I e-mailed all the members, thanking them for attending and informing them that you were responsible for the excellent charts in the presentation.
B) You have been a good customer for us, and he looks forward to serving you as long as he has this paper route, so John will also be over to personally apologize.
C) They got engaged with an activity we were doing, and they completely forgot about keeping their voices down, and I must admit that I got carried away as well.
D) I expect that we make another appointment for next week because I enjoy being together and it gives me a much-needed break from the stress here at the office.
E) I apologize for the damage our worker did to your screen door, but Martinez has been delivering newspapers for three years and this is the first time he has done such a thing.
A B C D E

Read the text and choose the best answer about how Sally feels.

 

Dear Diary,

 

I feel so sad today because my exam was so bad. I wish that I had studied more to pass this exam. But I don’t have another chance and I can’t change it.

 

Sally.

A) Sally is angry because she couldn’t study her exam very much.
B) Sally is regretful about not having studied her exam well enough.
C) Sally is confused about her exam because she didn’t study enough.
D) Sally is surprised about her exam because she learnt the results.
E) Sally is relaxed about her exam because she studied too much.
A B C D E

questionAsHtml:
Soru 1: 53046

Dear Jessica,

 

I just want to apologize for yesterday. I shouldn’t have behaved so rude and shouted at you. It was my fault. I didn’t mean to hurt you. You know, I was so sad because my exam result was too bad. Besides, I argued with my mother. I’m terribly sorry about my thoughtlessness. When you asked about my exam result, I lost my control, and I said that it was none of your business. Please, forgive me! You are my best friend.

Judy

 

Which information is not included in the letter given above?

A) why she wrote the letter
B) why she was unhappy
C) what her intention was
D) how her exam result was
E) who she argued with
A B C D E

Which of the following is closest in meaning to the sentence given below?

Alice shouldn't have talked to her boss in such a rude manner yesterday, I think she couldn't hide her feelings.

A) Alice mustn't have talked to her boss so angry that the boss couldn't avoid his anger easily yesterday.
B) The reason why Alice talked to her boss so rudely yesterday is the feeling she had for her boss. 
C) Alice can't have talked to her boss such a rude way yesterday because she can easily avoid her feelings. 
D) The way Alice talked to her boss yesterday is wrong and she wasn't able to prevent her feelings.
E) Her boss shouldn't have talked to Alice in such a rude way, she may not have avoided getting angry.
A B C D E

Our missing the last bus was because of me because I should have kept the timetable in mind. II. It was not my intention to miss the last bus, but you should have remembered the timetable. III. I did not mean to miss the last bus because I should have remembered the timetable last night. IV. I want to give an explanation about missing the last bus because I was really unhappy about it. V. If only you had remembered the timetable last night because we missed the last bus. A) I B) II C) III D) IV E) V A B C D E
question:
Which of the following is closest in meaning to the sentence given below?
It was my fault to miss the last bus because I had forgotten the timetable.
I. Our missing the last bus was because of me because I should have kept the timetable in mind.
II. It was not my intention to miss the last bus, but you should have remembered the timetable.
III. I did not mean to miss the last bus because I should have remembered the timetable last night.
IV. I want to give an explanation about missing the last bus because I was really unhappy about it.
V. If only you had remembered the timetable last night because we missed the last bus.

questionText: A) B) C) D) E) A B C D E
